tags.name: Offers
tags.description: Operations related to offers and the decentralized marketplace functionality.

post.description: Add a nrequired-to-sign multisignature address to the wallet. Each key is a Syscoin address or hex-encoded public key. If 'account' is specified (DEPRECATED), assign address to that account.

200.description: A syscoin address associated with the keys.

get.description: list affiliations with merchant offers.

Authenticates an alias with a provided password and returns the private key if successful. Warning: Calling this function over a public network can lead to someone reading your password/private key in plain text.

Filter aliases [regexp] : apply [regexp] on aliases, empty means all aliases [from] : show results from this GUID [from], empty means first. [aliasfilter] : shows all aliases that are safe to display (not on the ban list) aliasfilter "" 5 = list aliases updated in last 5 blocks aliasfilter "^alias" = list all aliases starting with "alias" aliasfilter 36000 0 0 stat = display stats (number of aliases) on active aliases

parameters.name: regexp
parameters.description: apply [regexp] on aliases, empty means all aliases

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: show results from this GUID [from], empty means first

parameters.name: safesearch
parameters.description: shows all aliases that are safe to display (not on the ban list)

get.description: List all stored values of an alias.
Show values of an alias.
List my own aliases.

parameters.name: aliasname
parameters.description: Alias name to use as filter.

post.description: Creates a new Syscoin Alias. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Update and possibly transfer an alias. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.

get.description: scan and filter certs certfilter "" 5 = list certs updated in last 5 blocks certfilter "^cert" = list all certs starting with "cert" certfilter 36000 0 0 stat = display stats (number of certs) on active certs

parameters.name: regexp
parameters.description: apply [regexp] on certes, empty means all certes

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: show results from number [from]

parameters.name: certfilter
parameters.description: shows all certs that are safe to display (not on the ban list)

parameters.name: safesearch
parameters.description: shows all certs that are safe to display (not on the ban list)

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: category you want to search in, empty for all

get.description: List all stored values of an cert.
Show stored values of a single certificate.
List certificates that an array of aliases own. Set of aliases to look up based on alias, and private key to decrypt any data found in certificates.

post.description: Create a new Syscoin Certificate. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Transfer certificate from one user to another. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Perform an update on an certificate you control. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.

get.description: Reveals the private key corresponding to 'syscoinaddress'. Then the importprivkey can be used with this output.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The syscoin address for the private key

get.description: Dumps all wallet keys in a human-readable format.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The filename

post.description: Acknowledge escrow payment as seller of offer. Deducts qty of offer and increases number of sold inventory.
Claim escrow funds released from seller or arbiter using escrowrefund. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Claim escrow funds released from buyer or arbiter using escrowrelease. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Completes an escrow refund by creating the escrow complete refund transaction on syscoin blockchain.
Completes an escrow release by creating the escrow complete release transaction on syscoin blockchain.

Send feedback for primary and secondary users in escrow, depending on who you are. Ratings are numbers from 1 to 5. User Role is either 'buyer', 'seller', 'reseller', or 'arbiter'. If you are the buyer, feedbackprimary is for seller and feedbacksecondary is for arbiter. If you are the seller, feedbackprimary is for buyer and feedbacksecondary is for arbiter. If you are the arbiter, feedbackprimary is for buyer and feedbacksecondary is for seller. If arbiter didn't do any work for this escrow you can leave his feedback empty and rating as a 0.

get.description: scan and filter escrows

parameters.name: regexp
parameters.description: Apply [regexp] on escrows, empty means all escrows

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Show results from this GUID [from], 0 means first.

parameters.name: escrow
parameters.description: GUID of escrow

parameters.name: escrow
parameters.description: GUID of escrow

parameters.name: escrow
parameters.description: GUID of escrow

parameters.name: privatekey
parameters.description: private key for decoding data

post.description: Create new arbitrated Syscoin escrow.

Refunds escrow funds back to buyer, buyer needs to sign the output transaction and send to the network. User role represents either 'seller' or 'arbiter'. Enter in rawTx if this is an external payment refund.

Releases escrow funds to seller, seller needs to sign the output transaction and send to the network. User role represents either 'buyer' or 'arbiter'. Enter in rawTx if this is an external payment release.
Generates a multisignature escrow transaction

get.description: DEPRECATED. Returns the account associated with the given address.

parameters.name: syscoinaddress
parameters.description: The syscoin address for account lookup.

get.description: DEPRECATED. Returns the current Syscoin address for receiving payments to this account.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The account name for the address. It can also be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. The account does not need to exist, it will be created and a new address created  if there is no account by the given name.

get.description: DEPRECATED. Returns the list of addresses for the given account.

If account is not specified, returns the server's total available balance. If account is specified (DEPRECATED), returns the balance in the account. Note that the account "" is not the same as leaving the parameter out. The server total may be different to the balance in the default "" account.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: DEPRECATED. The selected account, or "*" for entire wallet. It may be the default account using "".

parameters.name: minconf
parameters.description: Only include transactions confirmed at least this many times.

parameters.name: includeWatchonly
parameters.description: Also include balance in watchonly addresses (see 'importaddress')

get.description: Returns an object containing various state info.
Returns a json object containing mining-related information.

post.description: Returns a new Syscoin address for receiving payments. If 'account' is specified (DEPRECATED), it is added to the address book so payments received with the address will be credited to 'account'.

get.description: Returns data about each connected network node as a json array of objects.
DEPRECATED. Returns the total amount received by addresses with <account> in transactions with at least [minconf] confirmations.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The selected account, may be the default account using "".

parameters.name: minconf
parameters.description: Only include transactions confirmed at least this many times.

get.description: Returns the total amount received by the given syscoinaddress in transactions with at least minconf confirmations.

parameters.name: syscoinaddress
parameters.description: The syscoin address for transactions.

parameters.name: minconf
parameters.description: Only include transactions confirmed at least this many times.

parameters.name: includeWatchonly
parameters.description: Whether to include watchonly addresses in balance calculation and details[]

get.description: Returns the server's total unconfirmed balance

Returns a new Syscoin (starts with 1) address for receiving payments. If 'account' is specified (DEPRECATED), it is added to the address book so payments received with the address will be credited to 'account'.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: DEPRECATED. The account name for the address to be linked to. If not provided, the default account "" is used. It can also be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. The account does not need to exist, it will be created if there is no account by the given name.

get.description: Returns an object containing various wallet state info.
Returns a new ZCash address for receiving payments in ZCash transaparent tokens. so payments received with the address will be credited to 'account'.
Adds a script (in hex) or address that can be watched as if it were in your wallet but cannot be used to spend.
Adds a private key (as returned by dumpprivkey) to your wallet.

Imports funds without rescan. Corresponding address or script must previously be included in wallet. Aimed towards pruned wallets. The end-user is responsible to import additional transactions that subsequently spend the imported outputs or rescan after the point in the blockchain the transaction is included.
Adds a public key (in hex) that can be watched as if it were in your wallet but cannot be used to spend.
Imports keys from a wallet dump file (see dumpwallet).
DEPRECATED. Returns Object that has account names as keys, account balances as values.

parameters.description: Only include transactions with at least this many confirmations

parameters.description: Include balances in watchonly addresses (see 'importaddress')

parameters.description: Include transactions to watchonly addresses (see 'importaddress')

get.description: List all affiliates for this offer.
Deletes the specified transaction from the wallet. Meant for use with pruned wallets and as a companion to importprunedfunds. This will effect wallet balances.

post.description: DEPRECATED (use sendtoaddress). Sent an amount from an account to a syscoin address. The amount is a real and is rounded to the nearest 0.00000001. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Send multiple times. Amounts are double-precision floating point numbers. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Send an amount to a given address. The amount is a real and is rounded to the nearest 0.00000001. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Sign a message with the private key of an address. Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Decode raw syscoin transaction (serialized, hex-encoded) and display information pertaining to the service that is included in the transactiion data output(OP_RETURN)
Sign inputs for raw transaction (serialized, hex-encoded) and sends them out to the network if signing is complete
Return information about the given syscoin address.
Verify a signed message

parameters.name: syscoinaddress
parameters.description: The syscoin address to use for the signature.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: The signature provided by the signer in base 64 encoding (see signmessage).

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message that was signed.

200.description: If the signature is verified or not.

post.description: Removes the wallet encryption key from memory, locking the wallet. After calling this method, you will need to call walletpassphrase again before being able to call any methods which require the wallet to be unlocked.
Stores the wallet decryption key in memory for 'timeout' seconds. This is needed prior to performing transactions related to private keys such as sending syscoins
Changes the wallet passphrase from 'oldpassphrase' to 'newpassphrase'.

balance.description: the total syscoin balance of the wallet

blocks.description: the current number of blocks processed in the server

proxy.description: the proxy used by the server

testnet.description: if the server is using testnet or not

keypoololdest.description: the timestamp (seconds since GMT epoch) of the oldest pre-generated key in the key pool

keypoolsize.description: how many new keys are pre-generated

unlocked_until.description: the timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked

paytxfee.description: the transaction fee set in SYS/kB

relayfee.description: minimum relay fee for non-free transactions in SYS/kB

genproclimit.description: The processor limit for generation. -1 if no generation.

pooledtx.description: The size of the mem pool

chain.description: current network name as defined in BIP70 (main, test, regtest)

generate.description: If the generation is on or off (see getgenerate or setgenerate calls)

addr.description: The ip address and port of the peer

relaytxes.description: Whether peer has asked us to relay transactions to it

lastsend.description: The time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT) of the last send

lastrecv.description: The time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT) of the last receive

conntime.description: The connection time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)

startingheight.description: The starting height (block) of the peer

synced_headers.description: The last header we have in common with this peer

synced_blocks.description: The last block we have in common with this peer

inflight.description: The heights of blocks we're currently asking from this peer

isvalid.description: If the address is valid or not. If not, this is the only property returned.

ismine.description: If the address is yours or not

isscript.description: If the key is a script

pubkey.description: The hex value of the raw public key

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account associated with the address, "" is the default account

blocktime.description: The time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)

time.description: The transaction time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)

timereceived.description: The time received in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account name involved in the transaction, can be "" for the default account.

address.description: The syscoin address involved in the transaction

label.description: A comment for the address/transaction, if any

balance.description: the total confirmed balance of the wallet in SYS

unconfirmed_balance.description: the total unconfirmed balance of the wallet in SYS

immature_balance.description: the total immature balance of the wallet in SYS

txcount.description: the total number of transactions in the wallet

keypoololdest.description: the timestamp (seconds since GMT epoch) of the oldest pre-generated key in the key pool

keypoolsize.description: how many new keys are pre-generated

unlocked_until.description: the timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked

paytxfee.description: the transaction fee configuration, set in SYS/kB

involvesWatchonly.description: Only returned if imported addresses were involved in transaction

account.description: The account name of the receiving account

amount.description: The total amount received by addresses with this account

confirmations.description: The number of confirmations of the most recent transaction included

label.description: A comment for the address/transaction, if any

lastblock.description: The hash of the last block

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account name associated with the transaction. Will be "" for the default account.

address.description: The syscoin address of the transaction. Not present for move transactions (category = move).

category.description: The transaction category. 'send' has negative amounts, 'receive' has positive amounts.

amount.description: The amount in SYS. This is negative for the 'send' category, and for the 'move' category for moves outbound. It is positive for the 'receive' category, and for the 'move' category for inbound funds.

fee.description: The amount of the fee in SYS. This is negative and only available for the 'send' category of transactions.

confirmations.description: The number of confirmations for the transaction. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

blockhash.description: The block hash containing the transaction. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

blockindex.description: The block index containing the transaction. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

blocktime.description: The block time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT).

txid.description: The transaction id. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

time.description: The transaction time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT).

timereceived.description: The time received in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT). Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

comment.description: If a comment is associated with the transaction.

label.description: A comment for the address/transaction, if any

to.description: If a comment to is associated with the transaction.

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account name associated with the transaction. It will be "" for the default account.

address.description: The syscoin address of the transaction. Not present for move transactions (category = move).

category.description: The transaction category. 'move' is a local (off blockchain) transaction between accounts, and not associated with an address, transaction id or block. 'send' and 'receive' transactions are associated with an address, transaction id and block details

amount.description: The amount in SYS. This is negative for the 'send' category, and for the 'move' category for moves outbound. It is positive for the 'receive' category, and for the 'move' category for inbound funds.

fee.description: The amount of the fee in SYS. This is negative and only available for the 'send' category of transactions.

confirmations.description: The number of confirmations for the transaction. Available for 'send' and'receive' category of transactions. Negative confirmations indicate the transation conflicts with the block chain

trusted.description: Whether we consider the outputs of this unconfirmed transaction safe to spend.

blockhash.description: The block hash containing the transaction. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

blockindex.description: The block index containing the transaction. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

blocktime.description: The block time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT).

txid.description: The transaction id. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

time.description: The transaction time in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT).

timereceived.description: The time received in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT). Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

comment.description: If a comment is associated with the transaction.

label.description: A comment for the address/transaction, if any

otheraccount.description: For the 'move' category of transactions, the account the funds came from (for receiving funds, positive amounts), or went to (for sending funds, negative amounts).

nrequired.description: The number of required signatures out of the n keys or addresses.

keysobject.description: A json array of syscoin addresses or hex-encoded public keys. [ "address"  (string) syscoin address or hex-encoded public key ... ]

account.description: DEPRECATED. An account to assign the addresses to.

aliaspeg.description: Alias peg which will be used for conversion operations on all Syscoin services related to this Alias

publicvalue.description: Alias public profile data, 1023 chars max.

privatevalue.description: Alias private profile data, 1023 chars max. Will be private and readable by owner only.

password.description: Used to generate your public/private key that controls this alias. Warning: Calling this function over a public network can lead to someone reading your password in plain text.

safesearch.description: set to No if this alias should only show in the search when safe search is not selected. Defaults to Yes (alias shows with or without safe search selected in search lists).

accepttransfers.description: set to No if this alias should not allow a certificate to be transferred to it. Defaults to Yes.

expire.description: Time in seconds. Future time when to expire alias. It is exponentially more expensive per year, calculation is FEERATE*(1.5^years). FEERATE is the dynamic satoshi per byte fee set in the rate peg alias used for this alias. Defaults to 1 year.

nrequired.description: For multisig aliases only. The number of required signatures out of the n aliases for a multisig alias update.

aliases.description: For multisig aliases only. A json array of aliases which are used to sign on an update to this alias. [ "alias"    Existing syscoin alias name ,... ]

aliaspeg.description: Alias peg which will be used for conversion operations on all Syscoin services related to this Alias

publicvalue.description: Alias public profile data, 1023 chars max.

privatevalue.description: Alias private profile data, 1023 chars max. Will be private and readable by owner only.

password.description: Used to generate your public/private key that controls this alias. Warning: Calling this function over a public network can lead to someone reading your password in plain text.

safesearch.description: set to No if this alias should only show in the search when safe search is not selected. Defaults to Yes (alias shows with or without safe search selected in search lists).

toalias_pubkey.description: receiver syscoin alias pub key, if transferring alias.

accepttransfers.description: set to No if this alias should not allow a certificate to be transferred to it. Defaults to Yes.

expire.description: Time in seconds. Future time when to expire alias. It is exponentially more expensive per year, calculation is FEERATE*(1.5^years). FEERATE is the dynamic satoshi per byte fee set in the rate peg alias used for this alias. Defaults to 1 year.

nrequired.description: For multisig aliases only. The number of required signatures out of the n aliases for a multisig alias update.

aliases.description: For multisig aliases only. A json array of aliases which are used to sign on an update to this alias. [ "alias"    Existing syscoin alias name ,... ]

safesearch.description: set to No if this cert should only show in the search when safe search is not selected. Defaults to Yes (cert shows with or without safe search selected in search lists).

category.description: category, 25 characters max. Defaults to certificates;

alias.description: Alias to transfer this certificate to.

viewonly.description: Transfer the certificate as view-only. Recipient cannot edit, transfer or sell this certificate in the future.

alias.description: an alias you own to associate with this certificate.

safesearch.description: set to No if this cert should only show in the search when safe search is not selected. Defaults to Yes (cert shows with or without safe search selected in search lists).

category.description: category, 256 characters max. Defaults to certificates

offer.description: GUID of offer that this escrow is managing.

quantity.description: Quantity of items to buy of offer.

message.description: Delivery details to seller. 256 characters max.

exttx.description: External transaction ID if paid with another blockchain.

paymentoption.description: If extTx is defined, specify a valid payment option used to make payment. Default is SYS.

redeemscript.description: If paid in external chain, enter redeemScript that generateescrowmultisig returns

height.description: If paid in extneral chain, enter height that generateescrowmultisig returns

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account name for the address to be linked to. If not provided, the default account "" is used. It can also be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. The account does not need to exist, it will be created if there is no account by the given name.

p2sh.description: Add the P2SH version of the script as well

hex.description: Is data an hex based message(only To-Message will be displayed). No by default.

fromaccount.description: The name of the account to move funds from. May be the default account using "".

toaccount.description: The name of the account to move funds to. May be the default account using "".

amount.description: Quantity of SYS to move between accounts.

minconf.description: Only use funds with at least this many confirmations.

comment.description: An optional comment, stored in the wallet only.

exttxid.description: If paid in another coin, enter the Transaction ID here. Default is empty.

paymentoption.description: If Ext TxId is defined, specify a valid payment option used to make payment. Default is SYS.

offerguid.description: offer guid that you are adding to

aliasguid.description: alias guid representing an alias that you want to add to the affiliate list

discountPercentage.description: Percentage of discount given to affiliate for this offer. 0 to 99.

guid.description: offer guid that you are linking to

comission.description: percentage of profit desired over original offer price, > 0, ie 5 for 5%

description.description: description, 1 KB max. Defaults to original description. Leave as '' to use default.

currency.description: The currency code that you want your offer to be in ie USD.

certguid.description: Set this to the guid of a certificate you wish to sell

paymentoptions.description: 'SYS' to accept SYS only, 'BTC' for BTC only, 'ZEC' for zcash only, or a |-delimited string to accept multiple currencies (e.g. 'BTC|SYS' to accept BTC or SYS). Leave empty for default. Defaults to 'SYS'.

geolocation.description: set to your geolocation. Defaults to empty.

safesearch.description: set to No if this offer should only show in the search when safe search is not selected. Defaults to Yes (offer shows with or without safe search selected in search lists).

private.description: set to 1 if this offer should be private not be searchable. Defaults to 0.

currency.description: The currency code that you want your offer to be in ie USD.

private.description: set to 1 if this offer should be private not be searchable. Defaults to 0.

certguid.description: Set this to the guid of a certificate you wish to sell

geolocation.description: set to your geolocation. Defaults to empty.

safesearch.description: set to No if this offer should only show in the search when safe search is not selected. Defaults to Yes (offer shows with or without safe search selected in search lists).

paymentoptions.description: 'SYS' to accept SYS only, 'BTC' for BTC only, 'ZEC' for zcash only, or a |-delimited string to accept multiple currencies (e.g. 'BTC|SYS' to accept BTC or SYS). Leave empty for default. Defaults to 'SYS'.

fromaccount.description: The name of the account to send funds from. May be the default account using "".

tosyscoinaddress.description: The syscoin address to send funds to.

amount.description: he amount in SYS (transaction fee is added on top).

minconf.description: Only use funds with at least this many confirmations.

comment.description: A comment used to store what the transaction is for. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

commentto.description: An optional comment to store the name of the person or organization to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the transaction, it is just kept in your wallet.

fromaccount.description: DEPRECATED. The account to send the funds from. Should be "" for the default account

amounts.description: A json object with addresses and amounts { "address":amount   (numeric) The syscoin address is the key, the numeric amount in SYS is the value,...}

minconf.description: Only use the balance confirmed at least this many times.

comment.description: A comment used to store what the transaction is for. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

subtractfeefromamount.description: A json array with addresses. The fee will be equally deducted from the amount of each selected address. Those recipients will receive less syscoins than you enter in their corresponding amount field. If no addresses are specified here, the sender pays the fee. [ "address" Subtract fee from this address,... ]

syscoinaddress.description: The syscoin address to send to.

amount.description: The amount in SYS to send. eg 0.1

comment.description: A comment used to store what the transaction is for. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

commentto.description: An optional comment to store the name of the person or organization to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the transaction, it is just kept in your wallet.

subtractfeefromamount.description: The fee will be deducted from the amount being sent. The recipient will receive less syscoins than you enter in the amount field.

syscoinaddress.description: The syscoin address to use for the private key.

message.description: The message to create a signature of.

timeout.description: The time to keep the decryption key in seconds.
